flood_zone_analysis.verification_method: Palm Bay GIS Flood Zone Map

brevard_county.department: Brevard County Public Works Floodplain Administration

if_in_flood_zone.requirement: Floodplain permit required BEFORE building permit

verification.method: Check if parcel in Scrub Jay Polygon

if_in_habitat_area.clearing_restriction: NO land clearing March 1 - June 30 (nesting season)
if_in_habitat_area.building_allowed: Yes, on already cleared areas during nesting season

eastern_indigo_snake.habitat: Uses gopher tortoise burrows for overwintering

gopher_tortoise.permit_required_from: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC)

requirements.buffer_zone: No disturbance within 25 feet of burrow
requirements.authorized_agent: Must use FWC-certified agent for relocation

gopher_tortoise.typical_habitat: Sandy, well-drained soils (common in Palm Bay)

wetlands.jurisdiction: St. Johns River Water Management District (SJRWMD)
wetlands.permit_required: Environmental Resource Permit (ERP) if wetlands present

verification_methods.method: Hire environmental consultant for wetland delineation
verification_methods.note: Most reliable method - establishes legal boundaries for 5 years

sandy_pines_context.note: Sandy Pines is established subdivision - likely previous ERP issued
sandy_pines_context.action: Check SJRWMD records for existing permits on subdivision

pre_development_checklist.item: Florida Fish & Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC) review
pre_development_checklist.purpose: Endangered wildlife check (indigo snake, scrub-jay, gopher tortoise)

pre_development_checklist.method: City GIS map or Building Department
Palm Bay GIS or Building Department

likely_constraints.scrub_jay: MEDIUM - Sandy Pines is in SE Palm Bay near habitat areas
likely_constraints.gopher_tortoise: HIGH - sandy soils common in area
likely_constraints.wetlands: LOW-MEDIUM - established subdivision likely already permitted

action_items.action: Verify flood zone on Palm Bay GIS
Check scrub-jay polygon map for parcel
Site visit to check for gopher tortoise burrows
action_items.note: Look for mounded sand aprons at burrow entrances
action_items.if_found: Contact FWC at (321) 383-5535 before any clearing

action_items.action: Confirm no wetlands on site via visual inspection

next_stage.name: Parking Analysis
actions: Determine proposed use (residential units, commercial SF)
Check Palm Bay parking code requirements
